Reviews.Title: Sony HX300 a winner
Reviews.Author: Country Boy
Reviews.Content: I photograph mostly wild life so I value a camera that has a lot of optical telephoto power.  This camera has a super range in that department.  I can go from 25 mm to 1200 mm in nothing flat by using the zoom lever by the shutter button.  What is really nice is I can fine tune the zoom by using the zoom ring located around the lens barrel.  The best wildlife pictures are many times taken in low light.  I have an oriole picture taken at 3200 ISO that turned out totally acceptable. I have 2 very good DSLR's and a $1700+ lens for them.  They have mostly been sittin in my safe since I got the HX300. That tell you how much I like this camera.  I read a couple of reviews that made me wonder if I should buy this camera or not so I bought it from Amazon so I could be sure I could return it without trouble if I didn't like it. Return it! They would have to come and take it from me!!Yes, I would recomend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: It is an excellent point and shoot...
Reviews.Author: Glen Hurley
Reviews.Content: The zoom is amazing! Double what I can get out of my expensive SLR...But it has it's flaws. The camera has lots of extra functions and controls, but the instructions are pretty lame and almost non existent. The speed that it processes pictures is kind of slow, so you have to wait for it to process for a few seconds while it blocks the screen. So, not the best for action shots. Although it does work for a single staged photo... Say you are photoing a swing at a baseball game. You'll get the hit, but the play will be over before you can take any additional photos. The video works well. Very stable. And the zoom is active while filming. ( Its not on my other camera) So you can get some nice video. All in all its a very good "one stop" camera. I bought it to take on vacation so I dont have to lug around my big camera, all the lenses, AND a video camera. I think it is going to work out great.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: marnmr
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I went to South Africa and I took over 1900 photo and 2 hours of video and  it worked flawlessly.The panoramic setting worked great in the mountain areas, the back light setting worked great on the night safari where I took pictures of zebras, lions, and elephants.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: karen eddinger
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful pictures,very easy to work,love the zoom.You can take close ups from a good distance away with  the picture still perfect

Reviews.Title: Amazing Marvel of Technology with Excellent Carl Zeiss Optics
Reviews.Author: hhbva
Reviews.Content: Update 1, 11/2/2013: I had forgotten that this camera came bundled with several other goodies, and in fairness to those, I just wanted to mention that the 32 GB Sony SDHC card works well, the extra battery pack with the external charger comes in really handy (beats charging the battery in the camera ... Sony really should have included one in the box), the gadget bag is barely large enough to hold the camera and maybe a couple of memory cards (I bought a medium-sized Sony-branded bag separately), and the "flexible tripod" is useless (I threw it away), the DVD on digital photography is generic, not Sony-specific, so pulling up the online user's manual will be a lot more instructive. That reminds me, again Sony skimped here ... the included camera documentation is minimal and inadequate for familiarization with the camera. Also, Sony might have drilled a hole in the lens cap and put a string through it for attachment to the camera carrying strap or lens so it won't drop off and get lost ... I bought a non-Sony, tethered lens cap separately. These are my nits, none detract from the value of the camera itself.I decided to buy this camera simply because I was looking for a competent, light-weight alternative to my Canon EOS DSLR, which generally involved lugging around a heavy gadget bag full of interchangeable lenses on my frequent globetrotter trips, and I wanted an extreme zoom lens for occasionally shooting birds, wildlife and other targets of opportunity at significant distances. Adding a Canon super-telephoto lens to my inventory would have further increased the weight to be carried, not to mention that it would hardly have been cost-effective considering the questionable amount of use I would have gotten out of it. After scouring the reviews of the Canon SX50, Panasonic Lumix FZ200, and the Sony DSC-HX300, I chose the latter, ultimately because I had always loved my now almost "ancient" Sony DSC-R1 with its priceless Carl Zeiss optics. I've only had the HX300 for about 3 weeks and have not been able to test it extensively in the field, i.e., on one of my trips, which often yield thousands of photos. Rather I've used it indoors, in front of the house and in my back yard and on short drives. Thus far, I can only say that I have not been disappointed. The Carl Zeiss f/2.8-6.3 24-1200 mm Vario-Sonnar T* optics produce tack-sharp images, especially at the shorter focal lengths, but even my moon shots that I eagerly attempted almost as soon as I got the camera out of the box, turned out to be unexpectedly good, especially after improving brightness and contrast in Photoshop a bit. AF is fast and precise even in low light (although holding the Moon in steady focus initially proved a bit challenging), color rendition is excellent, and the camera is especially competent in the Intelligent Auto mode. In fact, even though I prefer shooting in either aperture or shutter priority, depending on lighting conditions and subject, I found that using intelligent auto often produced better results. I do miss being able to shoot in RAW, but the 20.1 MP Jpeg images are generally exceptionally crisp. When they're not, it's always my fault, not the camera's. I have not shot videos with the camera, except to try it on a CNN TV newscast, and the image quality, again using intelligent auto, under these low-light conditions, simply amazed me. i did not want to make this a lengthy "technical" review because of my rather limited experience with the camera at this time, but I may update it later, after my next "photo safari."

Reviews.Title: Excelent product and provider
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Nizetich
Reviews.Content: Product: Excellent product, quality and accessories are right and a great relation product-price. The quality of the pictures are awesome and let user create many different options and shades.Provider: Excellent option as provider, really kind and customer care. Thanks for everything, I entered the wrong address and they put in contact with me and make all the arrangements to keep tracking and shipping on time.

Reviews.Title: Canon fan gets converted by this terrific Sony camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Caton
Reviews.Content: I have owned nothing but Canon cameras since becoming more serious about photography. I would never have even considered buying a Sony camera if it weren't for the recommendation of a friend who is basically a professional photographer. She had this camera with her on a trip a group of us took to Kenya. Like me, she was a huge Canon fan but she really seemed impressed with this unit. Once we got back and I saw her photos, I was sold! It does't have interchangeable lenses so the complete flexibility is not the same as a true SLR. However, the built in 50x zoom lens meets every need that I have and the photo quality is simply amazing....better than any other camera I have owned! The real beauty is that my wife, who isn't going to use the custom modes, can also take beautiful photos in both of the auto modes. I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Bsheppard
Reviews.Content: I bought this item several weeks ago but returned it because it did not perform up to the Sony standards I was expecting. I have a HX100 and I love it, but I wanted to upgrade, but this camera falls well short. When taking pictures, the lens appears jumpy, especially in long zooms. I had it mounted to my tripod and when zoomed the lens seems to jitter and would not take a smooth picture. Even in the same focal length as my HX100 it fell short. The only thing I could think of as to why this camera was failed was that it was made in China and my HX100 was made in Japan. Could be a quality issue, but I didn't want to try another HX300. Very disappointing because I've always had good luck with Sony products.

Reviews.Title: Awesome super quality camera.
Reviews.Author: Marion Olson
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. It is sooo awesome. The pics are beautiful & high quality. It is way above what I expected even though I knew it would really be a great camera. I had a sony cybershot before & each time I bought a better camera but this one is super awesome. I am soo pleased with it. I have recommended it to several people

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Rafael Zamora Barrientos
Reviews.Content: Very good quality.It came complete and in very good condition.I highly recommend this provider. And I highly recommend this photographic camera SONY.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera for beginners and old photo heads.
Reviews.Author: Busy Retiree "John"
Reviews.Content: My wife and  own a Canon SLR and two smaller point & shoots.  My wife was recently "drafted" to take pictures at a church event, and really loved the feel and ease of use of this camera.  Large LCD screen, very long zoom, and not heavy like my SLR.  Although I use iPhone a lot, this will be our new travel camera.  Like all cameras, included manual is lacking, but full 250 page manual is downloadable.

Reviews.Title: An excellent camera that could be better.
Reviews.Author: J. Peterson
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Sony camera and it is a very good camera. It takes excellent still photos and the videos are very good also. Battery life is very good. Though carrying a spare battery is a good idea. The biggest thing I wish Sony would improve on this camera is to be able to turn of instant replay. My earlier Sony was able to but not this one. When taking pictures of wildlife (My primary use) the time between pictures is to long and the information that shows up on the screen is distracting.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: roberto o leite
Reviews.Content: The camera has a lot of good features, great for a non-professional type. The bad part is the len cover, which doesnt have any kind of cord to hold it.The combo package is very usefull.

Reviews.Title: A Dream Camera For me!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Johnson C. Philip "Author of over 100 boo...
Reviews.Content: I am a compulsive photographer, and started shooting people and objects when I was 15. A friend presented me with my first digital camera when I was 45, and life has never been the same again. That was Sony Mavica, and it used 3.5 inch floppy disks to store pictures. The highest resolution was only 1.2 mega pixels, but with its 16x optical magnification it did wonders for me.This is my fourth digital Camera in 15 years. In fact the moment I read the specification and the Sony name, I sold my non Sonly Digital Single Lens Reflex (DSLR) camera, removable lens, and telephoto lens (puchased for a futune) at a loss and bought this model. Once again, life has never been the same again after I bought it.Here are some of the features*** It offer 20+ Mega-pixel resolution, something that can do wonders*** It offer and unbelievable 50x OPTICAL magnification, again something that can do wondersCare to Take:*** The camera offers so much in terms of resolution and optical magnification that most users need to learn afresh that a powerful tool can be used in unbelievable way. Do explore all the possibilities*** Do use a monopod or a tripod for shooting at magnifications greater than 20xUniqueness:*** High resolution*** Super-high magnification*** Ability to keep the flash off in any and every situation (a manual switch is provided)*** All other standard software features are available*** Very light and ergonomic designRecommendation:*** If ease of use, high resolution, and high optical magnification is your need, then this is THE camera for you*** It is very economically pricedI have been using this Camera now for 3 months and for me it is dream come true.

Reviews.Title: HELL YEAH
Reviews.Author: Emerito T. Delacruz
Reviews.Content: Hell yeah! Best freaking camera and bundle ever. I freaking love my new Sony dsc hx 300. I had the dsc hx 200 v of last year model and of course I had to get the new model of 2013. Love the Sony cyber shot.

Reviews.Title: Just about perfect!!
Reviews.Author: J. Hungerford
Reviews.Content: The only thing this bundle doesn't have is a strap for the neck and a lens cover attachment that fits on the cover and is elastic around the lens so you won't lose it. Pictures are crystal clear, even when there is quick movement. Just about the best digital camera I've ever had! Only down side is the battery seems to have to be charged more often . . . which I can deal with.

Reviews.Title: Just click buy...  Its that good
Reviews.Author: The Slacker
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful,  the pictures are great, the zoom is unbelievable, and the battery lasts all day and then some.  My only "complaint" is that at full zoom you should use the tripod due to the extreme zoom making keeping your target in site hard (and that's not the camera's fault).  For those that like low light or night shots this camera is hands down the best low light camera I have ever used.  the Canon SLR systems have NOTHING on the Sony for night shots in my opinion.  Firework shots are simple as well. All in all a GREAT system.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great, accessories okay
Reviews.Author: Buhl2752
Reviews.Content: Camera is great.  I love it.  Some of the accessories are good, some are a worthless.  The extra battery is really nice to have and the SD card.  However, the camera case was horrible.  If you put it around your neck it will flip upside down, plus it ripped within the first couple weeks of using it.  The mini tripod really is a MINI tripod.  I knew it would be small, but not this small.

Reviews.Title: The most important feature (zoom) is great
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: 4 stars since:- the zoom is absolutely awsome- would have gotten 5 stars had it had: (a) a remote control to shoot pictures without touching the camera instead of the DVD in the bundle about shooting pictures in general, and instead of a lens cleaning kit and/or (b) a software to control the camera from a PC when shooting pictures from a stand

Reviews.Title: Love the zoom
Reviews.Author: Liopino
Reviews.Content: The zoom is fantastic. The bundle was a great idea. The tripod is too small but it will do the job.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Susan C. Burke "buffalowm"
Reviews.Content: Everything arrived quickly as promised. Nice bundle of everything you might need. I took the camera to India and I was very happy how it performed. The 50 optical zoom is phenomenal. It also has several guides built into the camera so you don't have to get out a cumbersome users' guide. Took 1080 video too. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Sony camera
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn Etter
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a lot of time to learn this camera but it takes gorgeous pictures!!!!!!  It will take me some time to learn all the lingo associated with all the different features and how to use them but I am really impressed with it and am so glad I did my research and bought the one I did. I would recommend this camera to any and everyone looking for a still/movie camera.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: cher01
Reviews.Content: Its so o amazingly perfect. The picture quality is stunningly sharp and clear and does not have much lag. I have a lot of respect for it. Thr down side is its not something you can carry descretely.

Reviews.Title: This camera is the bees knees people.
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: With the 32GB card you'll have days worth of pictures and video. I haven't discovered all the features yet but the digital leveler, panoramic shot and the adjustable screen are just a few options that kick ass. This camera is worth every dollar. Oh, almost forget to mention the zoom, it's silly awesome--no changing lenses just to get a good shot.

Reviews.Title: Great Chritmas gift.
Reviews.Author: Fredrich H.
Reviews.Content: This is a great gift that keeps on giving for someone you love. We’ve already captured my memories to share with family and friends. The best feature is that it can be used with either the screen or the viewfinder. This is a great asset during bright sunlight. Strongly recommended for both beginners and expert photographers.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Karlla
Reviews.Content: The camera is good and the acessories too. I have enjoyed a lot my new camera. I think is a good buy

Reviews.Title: Good bundle for a reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: Rodolfo V. Castro
Reviews.Content: Just love the camera. The extra battery is not a Sony and it looks to dauer not so long. The battery charger works very well. Anyway is a very good bundle for the price.

Reviews.Title: Loved camera
Reviews.Author: Joanne Dupuis
Reviews.Content: I took the camera to Wyoming with me and loved it.  The zoom really draws far away objects up close.  Pictures nice and sharp.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Julio Ramires
Reviews.Content: This camera is better then i thought. I am very happy. Very easy to use the camera.I recommend The product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for! Lets me get great pictures of my birds and flowers. I love it! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price I paid.
Reviews.Author: Angeles
Reviews.Content: The camera is really good and the value added for the accessories was terrific. I review other sites and here I foy no the best offer.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have found
Reviews.Author: Skiput
Reviews.Content: Ihave a very nice Canon with a lot of lenses. For a grab and go camera this is the unit that does it all  video, WA, tele, panoramic superb unit

Reviews.Title: Add your own Wi-Fi ... AND GPS
Reviews.Author: N. D.
Reviews.Content: I have published a much expanded review based on my experiences with this camera so far here:Sony DSC-HX300/B 20 MP Digital Camera with 50x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCD (Black). Includes: 8GB Memory Card, Memory Card Wallet, Extended Life Replacement Battery, Table Top Tripod, LCD Screen Protectors, Cleaning Kit & Carrying CaseHowever this was my original review.I am interested in architecture where getting "up in the air" to photograph details on tall structures is just not possible. My old Panasonic with it's x18 zoom did pretty good at getting result from on the ground though, but the x50 zoom on this one is just too tempting.However it has taken me three months of research to finally decide that carrying a DSLR with all it's lenses everywhere I go - Just in case I see something of interest, is just not going to be practical for me sadly. The saying "The best camera is the one you have with you" (attributed to Andrew Harvey) has proved very true for me. There is no point in having a wonderful camera if carrying it with you all the time is not practical and you stop doing it. So it had to be a fixed-lens camera for me after all. This Sony just about wins over it's competitors for my needs.However, there are two massive drawbacks for me with this camera - No GPS and no RAW shooting. Those alone almost stopped me. Three further problems (but more minor ones for me) are no Wi-Fi, no hot shoe and no external mic & accessory sockets.Most of these I cannot do anything about, but I have been delighted to discover that at least you can add Wi-Fi to any camera by using a combined Wi-Fi and memory card in it's memory card slot:http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss?url=search-alias%3Delectronics&field-keywords;=wi-fi+sd+memory+cardAmazon offer quite a selection. I have only just discovered that memory cards with wireless Wi-Fi exist (8GB or 16GB are common, all rated 10 for speed, so more than fast enough for most, if not all current digital cameras).Today I wondered if it were possible to also add GPS to the memory card?  It took quite a bit of searching as I cannot seem to find a card with true GPS facilities, but I did find Eye-Fi cards like this one:Eye-Fi 16GB Pro X2 SDHC Class 10 Wireless Flash Memory Card Frustration Free Packaging EYE-FI-16PC-FFIt is 16GB and again class 10 for speed. It has Wi-Fi built in as well, but also note that they seem quite modest about it automatically adding GeoTagging information to every photo you take.  It is compatible with the Sony:[...]Reading the comments for the card, it seems that most of the criticisms are that you need to be near your Wi-Fi for it to work quickly and that you might have trouble with direct connection? (as soon as the card gets power, it starts to transmit your pictures immediately over the Wi-Fi if it is in range). I suppose you would not need direct connection under those circumstances though anyway. The limited range is understandable, since the aerial inside the card is shielded by the body of the camera itself.It does slow down your camera starting up and that might stop me from having it as my default card in the camera all the time. The problem seems to be that it searches for a wireless access point each time it is turned on. I might have to get two cards then, this Eye-Fi card for when I am visiting somewhere I am not very familiar with and a normal card for when I am somewhere familiar, but need to take a quick shot.So sadly not a perfect solution, but a possibility to consider if the lack of wireless connectivity or GPS is important to you? I just wish Sony would LISTEN to what the reviewers are saying, if only they would have built these in to the camera from the start, it would have had no real competition then. In camera special effects are nice toys, but really, how often are you likely to use them compared to RAW and GPS?I guess like most people, the rapid increase in speed of memory cards has left me with a nice little collection of still-useable cards (and once very expensive), but that are a bit slow now for regular use. So I am trying to "future-proof" my next memory card by getting one with plenty of memory, but outrageous speed that should keep it useful for a few years, hopefully until the card itself is wearing out:SanDisk Extreme Pro 64 GB SDXC Class 10 UHS-1 Flash Memory Card 95MB/s SDSDXPA-064G-AFFPBut you might want to consider paying a few cents more for the full retail packaging as there seems to be a few suspicions in the 1-Star comments that the memory cards they have received in frustration-free packaging might not have been genuine?I have also found a partial solution to the lack of a hot shoe.  There are slave flashes that are guaranteed to work with your digital camera anyway, such as this.Swivel, Bounce & Zoom Slave Flash With Flash Bracket For The Sony Mavica MVC-CD500 CD1000 CD350, DSC-HX1 DSC-H20/B DSC-H20, DSC-TX1 T90 WX1 W230, ALPHA DSLR A700 A300 A350 Includes Bonus Mini Tripod & Exclusive SSE Micro Fiber Cleaning ClothAlthough not as good as having a proper shoe built in to the camera from the start.  One of the slave flashes available that are compatible can help a lot with close to medium range shots that would need ISO400 or over as the grain really begins to show with this camera at that speed. Mine works like a dream with the Sony and with it taking 4 x AA batteries, it does not drain your precious camera battery either.I hope you enjoy your camera whatever model you decide to get.

Reviews.Title: Camer and bundle
Reviews.Author: Robert L Garrow
Reviews.Content: The quality is fantastic!! I have only one fault with the camera... the digital zoom has to be turned on to use each time the camera has been shut off!! The rest of the bundle is terrific!! Fantastic camera!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE Sony!
Reviews.Author: Julie M. King
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Sony point and shoot and I am very impressed with it. I handed the previous ones off to friends and family :-)

Reviews.Title: GPS not Really
Reviews.Author: City of Windom
Reviews.Content: The camera is great. What is missing is the information that you need additional hardware, etc. to have the camera as a GPS enabled device.  Very disappointed in that aspect.

ProductInfo.Features:
DSC-HX300/B Black 20.4MP Digital Camera with 50x Opt. Zoom and Optical SteadyShot
Includes Special DVD Guide to Digital Photography, 32 GB Class 10 SDHC Card
Compact Deluxe Gadget Bag, NP-BX1 1600MAH Battery Pack
Premium Tech AC/DC Battery Charger, Hi-Speed SD USB 2.0 Card Reader
Flexible Mini Table-top Tripod, 3pc. Lens Cleaning Kit
ProductInfo.Name: Sony DSC-HX300/B DSCHX300V DSC-HX300V Black Digital Camera 32GB Bundle - Includes 32 GB SDHC Memory Card - Class 10, Special DVD Guide to Digital Photography Compact Gadget Bag, NP-BX1 1600MAH Battery Pack, AC/DC Battery Charger + More
